name: Hammer
description: A tool used for pounding nails into surfaces. It typically consists of a handle and a heavy metal head.

name: Flat-head screwdriver
description: A screwdriver with a flat, straight blade used for tightening or loosening screws with a single slot.

name: Mallet
description: A hammer-like tool with a large, usually wooden head, used for striking or driving objects without damaging them.

name: Axe
description: A tool with a sharp, wedge-shaped metal blade attached to a wooden handle, used for chopping wood or cutting through materials.

name: Saw
description: A cutting tool with a toothed blade, used for cutting through various materials, such as wood or metal, by pushing or pulling the blade across the surface.

name: Scissors
description: Hand-operated cutting instruments with two sharp blades that are hinged together, used for cutting paper, fabric, or other thin materials.

name: Chisel
description: A tool with a sharp, flat metal blade on one end and a handle on the other, used for carving, shaping, or cutting hard materials such as wood or stone.

name: Pliers
description: Hand tools with two crossing metal levers, used for gripping, bending, or cutting wires, as well as holding or manipulating small objects.

name: Drill
description: A power tool with a rotating cutting or drilling attachment, used for creating holes in various materials, such as wood, metal, or plastic.

name: Tape measure
description: A flexible measuring tool, typically made of a long ribbon of metal or plastic, marked with linear measurements, used for measuring distances or dimensions.

name: Electric drill
description: A drill powered by electricity, eliminating the need for manual force and providing faster drilling capabilities.

name: Drill bits
description: Attachments for drills that have various shapes and sizes, used for drilling holes of different diameters or types.

name: Circular saw
description: A power saw with a circular blade that spins rapidly, used for making straight or curved cuts in wood, metal, or plastic.

name: Soldering iron
description: A tool with a heated metal tip used for melting solder, joining metal components, and creating electrical connections.

name: Electric screwdriver
description: A power tool that automatically rotates when pressure is applied, used for driving screws into surfaces quickly and effortlessly.

name: Chainsaw
description: A motorized saw with a chain of sharp teeth, used for cutting through large pieces of wood or trees.

name: Nail gun
description: A powered tool that drives nails into surfaces using compressed air or electromagnetism, making it faster and more efficient than manual hammering.

name: Wrench
description: A hand tool with a movable jaw that is used to grip and turn nuts, bolts, or other fasteners.

name: Monkeywrench
description: A type of adjustable wrench with a wide opening and long handle, used for gripping and turning larger nuts or bolts.

name: Hacksaw
description: A saw with a fine-toothed blade under tension, used for cutting through metal, plastic, or other tough materials.

name: Phillips screwdriver
description: A screwdriver with a cross-shaped blade designed to fit into Phillips head screws, which have a cross-shaped indentation on the top.

name: Hatchet
description: A small, single-handed axe with a short handle, used for chopping, shaping, or splitting wood.

name: Plane
description: A woodworking tool with a flat base and a cutting blade, used for smoothing or shaping wood surfaces.

name: Scraper
description: A handheld tool with a flat, sharp blade, used for scraping away paint, rust, or other unwanted materials from surfaces.

name: Bradawl
description: A small, pointed tool with a sharp tip, used for making small holes or starting screws in wood or other materials.

name: Coping saw
description: A thin, narrow-bladed saw with a U-shaped frame, used for making intricate cuts, curves, or patterns in wood or plastic.

name: Wire
description: A slender, flexible strand or rod made of metal, used for conducting electricity or for binding, securing, or supporting objects.

name: Nail
description: A thin, pointed metal fastener with a flat head, used for joining materials together by being driven or hammered into them.

name: Bolt
description: A threaded fastener with a head, typically used with a nut, used to hold objects or materials together.

name: Screw
description: A threaded fastener with a slotted or Phillips head, used to secure objects or materials by being rotated into place.

name: Nut
description: A small, typically hexagonal piece with internal threads, used in conjunction with a bolt to fasten or secure objects together.

name: Washer
description: A thin, flat disc with a hole in the center, used to distribute the load of a threaded fastener, such as a bolt or screw.

name: Spade
description: A digging tool with a flat, rectangular metal blade and a long handle, used for turning soil or digging trenches.

name: Shovel
description: A tool with a broad, scoop-shaped metal blade and a handle, used for lifting, moving, or scooping loose materials such as soil, sand, or snow.

name: Hoe
description: A long-handled gardening tool with a flat blade, usually set at a right angle to the handle, used for breaking up soil or chopping weeds.

name: Trowel
description: A handheld tool with a flat, pointed metal blade, used for spreading and leveling materials such as mortar, cement, or soil.

name: Lawnmower
description: A machine with rotating blades that cut grass to a desired height, used for maintaining lawns or large grassy areas.

name: Pruning shears
description: Hand-held gardening tools with two sharp blades, used for cutting or trimming plants, branches, or shrubs.

name: Toolbox
description: A portable container or case used for storing and carrying various tools and equipment.

name: Paint thinner
description: A solvent used to thin or dilute paint, clean brushes, or remove paint from surfaces.

name: Anvil
description: A heavy metal block with a flat top surface and various shaped indentations, used for shaping or forming metal objects using a hammer or other tools.

name: Sandpaper
description: A paper or cloth coated with abrasive material, used for smoothing or roughening surfaces by rubbing.

name: Workbench
description: A sturdy table or bench used as a surface for working on various projects or tasks, typically in a workshop or garage.

name: Sharpening stone
description: A rectangular block of abrasive material, such as natural or synthetic stone, used for sharpening the edges of cutting tools.

name: Vise / clamp
description: A device with two jaws or plates that can be tightened or secured together to hold an object firmly in place during work.

name: Stepladder
description: A self-supporting ladder with flat steps or rungs, designed to be easily folded or opened for reaching higher areas.

name: Corkscrew
description: A tool with a helical metal shaft and a handle, used for removing corks from bottles, typically wine bottles.

name: Cardboard boxes
description: Rectangular containers made of cardboard or corrugated material, used for storing, packaging, or transporting items.

name: Duct tape
description: A strong adhesive tape with a fabric backing, used for a variety of purposes, such as repairing, sealing, or bundling.

name: Flashlight
description: A portable, handheld electric light source, typically powered by batteries, used for illuminating dark areas or during power outages.

name: Paint brush
description: A brush with bristles or fibers used for applying paint or other liquid coatings to surfaces.

name: Broom
description: A cleaning tool with a long handle and a brush or collection of bristles, used for sweeping or cleaning floors.

name: Dustpan
description: A shallow, flat pan with a handle, used for collecting and disposing of dust, dirt, or debris swept from the floor with a broom.

name: Utility Knife
description: A versatile cutting tool with a retractable blade, used for various tasks such as opening packages, cutting materials, or scoring surfaces.

name: Putty Knife
description: A flat-bladed tool with a flexible metal or plastic blade, used for applying or removing putty, filler, or other substances.

name: Level
description: A tool with a flat base and a bubble or spirit-filled vial, used for determining whether a surface is horizontal (level) or vertical (plumb).

name: Wheelbarrow
description: A small, single-wheeled vehicle with handles and a bin or tray, used for transporting materials or heavy loads.

name: Stud Finder
description: A handheld device or tool used to locate the framing studs behind walls or ceilings, helping to securely hang objects or install fixtures.

name: Socket Set
description: A collection of sockets and associated accessories, used for tightening or loosening nuts, bolts, or screws with a ratcheting handle.

name: Multitool
description: A handheld tool with multiple built-in functions, such as pliers, knives, screwdrivers, and other tools, designed for versatility and convenience.

name: Hex key
description: Also known as an Allen wrench, a hex key is a small handheld tool with a hexagonal-shaped tip, used for turning screws or bolts with hexagonal sockets.
